thread.title: Royals postseason offers fan chance to recreate lost memories
thread.title_full: Royals postseason offers fan chance to recreate lost memories - KCTV5

author: Bonyen Lee, News Reporter
title: Royals postseason offers fan chance to recreate lost memories
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Making the World Series is more than just a fan's wish this Royals postseason, it's a father's hope to reclaim and recreate a memory he's lost forever.
Mike Philpot stares at pictures of him and his 15 year-old son Thomas Philpot from Game 2 of last year's World Series. They are clear as day, the two of them cheering on the boys in blue from Row G of Kauffman Stadium. But Philpot remembers none of it.
"I told him everything that had happened in the game, nothing. He didn't remember any of it," Thomas said.
Philpot, a commercial pilot, was on a layover in Philadelphia two weeks after that game when he suffered a stroke in the memory part of his brain.
"In the hospital when the doctor was talking to my wife about the World Series, I had no clue we had been to the World Series or anything had happened in that last month," Philpot said. 
He suffered a hemangioma, a brain bleed from a birth mark-like growth that doctors suspected had been there for years. It had never been a problem until the growth started to bleed.
The Philpot's are so confident in the Royals' making the World Series again, they haven't been to a postseason game yet.  They are saving the moment for Philpot to re-live with his son one year after the memory robbing stroke.
"This year I felt a lot more pressure because it's like, we've got to get back there so I can go figure out this World Series thing with my sons. I want to make sure we can talk about this 20 years from now about what a good time we had," he said.
